abstracts.cdata!:
The Sustainable Fisheries Development
            Project intended to identify innovative, and cost-effective
            mechanisms to strengthen the ocean fisheries management
            capacity of the Government, to be expanded according to the
            implementation of a Quota Management System (QMS). However,
            at approval time, it was realized that the project failed to
            be included by the Ministry of Agriculture in the multi-year
            Budget, as presented to the Ministry of Finance in mid-2001.
            After repeated requests by the Bank, the Ministry of
            Agriculture informed it had been compelled to prioritize its
            requirements within a tight CY2002 budget, thus, not
            considering the project a high priority, in addition to
            internal conflicts potentially affecting project
            implementation. Following the economic and political crises
            in the country, although the new administration expressed
            interest in the project, it was unable to assign the
            necessary budget for the project, and, on June 13, 2002 the
            Bank informed the Government of the formal withdrawal of the
            loan. This Project Completion Note stipulates the Bank
            conducted significant sector work linked to the project
            preparation, culminating in a Rural Development Working
            Paper, that provided an overview on marine fisheries,
            serving as well as an advisory document on the
            implementation of the QMS.
